Result.Abstract: As one of the most successful applications of image analysis and understanding, face recognition has recently received significant attention, especially during the past several years. Result.Title: Face Recognition: A Literature Survey

Result.Title: Scene Labeling by Relaxation Operations

Result.Abstract: A computer vision system for tracking multiple people in relatively unconstrained environments is described. Result.Title: Tracking Groups of People

Result.Abstract: It is shown that a digital arc S is the digitization of a straight line segment if and only if it has the "chord property:" the line segment joining any two points of S lies everywhere within distance 1 of S. This result is used to derive several regularity properties of digitizations of straight line segments.
Result.Title: Digital Straight Line Segments

Result.Abstract: A novel multiresolution image analysis technique based on hierarchies of irregular tessellations generated in parallel by independent stochastic processes is presented. Like traditional image pyramids these hierarchies are constructed in a number of steps on the order of log(image-size) steps. Result.Title: Hierarchical Image Analysis Using Irregular Tessellations

Result.Abstract: A special class of subsets of binary digital images called &quot;well-composed sets&quot; is defined.The sets of this class have very nice topological properties; for example, the Jordan CurveTheorem holds for them, their Euler characteristic is locally computable, and they have onlyone connectedness relation, since 4- and 8-connectedness are equivalent. This implies thatmany basic algorithms used in computer vision become simpler.
Result.Title: Well-Composed Sets

Result.Title: A Fast Parallel Algorithm for Blind Estimation of Noise Variance
